means: <英俚>研究员，科学工作者，技术专家

sentence.Network_en: A computer boffin is set to make £5million from his revolutionary photo technology.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个计算机天才准备靠他开发的革命性影像技术赚取500万英镑。

sentence.Network_en: Narrator: Sandy and Sue are coming home from school. They meet Professor Boffin.
sentence.Network_cn: 旁白: 桑迪和苏正从学校回家. 他们遇见了伯菲教授.

list.abs: the McKinsey boffins conclude that the " true " unemployment rate is around 15-17 % , which puts Sweden among the worst job-fillers in the EU .麦肯锡的研究人员推断，“真实的”失业率大约在15-17%，这就将瑞典打入了欧盟中最糟的岗位提供国之列。

list.exp: 给人印象刻板的酿酒专家
list.abs: 这三人不是一贯给人印象刻板的酿酒专家(wine boffins)，而是日夜操劳，但愿在这个竞争激烈的行业打响自己的名号的年青人，既然 …
military boffins have developed this bomb-proof' string vest' which can be fitted to armoured vehicles and withstand roadside blasts and grenades .军事科技工作者研制了一种可安装在装甲车上的“网眼背心”，用于防御路边炸弹和手榴弹。
some are internet boffins – people who spend huge amounts of time online and a thorough understanding of applications and internet user habits .有些人是互联网专家，他们花大量时间上网，对应用程序和网民习惯有着全面了解。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Second World War: of unknown origin

entry.tran: （尤指从事研究工作的）科学家，科技工作者
entry.def: A boffin is a scientist, especially one who is doing research.

example.ex: The boffins of Imperial College in London think they may have found a solution.
example.tran: 伦敦帝国理工学院的科研人员认为他们可能已经找到了解决办法。

entry.def: Very clever people are sometimes called boffins .

example.ex: A computer boffin is set to make £5million from his revolutionary photo technology.
example.tran: 一个计算机天才准备靠他开发的革命性影像技术赚取500万英镑。

means.word_mean: 1. a scientist or technician engaged in military research

auth_sentence.content: Teaming up with everyone's favourite boffin, Brian Eno, may seem slightly odd.
